intro: Oxyanthus schubotzianus, commonly known as the Schubotzian oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture.
